title: School timings changed in Himachal's Una from May 13 amid intense heat | Shimla News - Times of India
text: UNA: In response to the soaring temperatures in Una, which reached a maximum of 39.4 degrees Celsius on Thursday, the district administration has taken steps to ensure the safety and well-being of students. As per an official notification issued by District Magistrate Jatin Lal, school timings have been adjusted starting from May 13.The order, which applies to all government and private schools in Una, stipulates that educational institutions will now operate from 8 am to 1 pm. To accommodate this change, the duration of morning prayer and breaks will be reduced, allowing schools to compensate for the shortened hours. The revised schedule will be implemented across primary, higher, and senior secondary schools.The decision to alter school timings was made based on the recommendations of the Deputy Directors of Higher and Elementary Education. Officials have confirmed that the new schedule will remain in effect until further notice, as the administration continues to prioritize the health and comfort of students amidst the intense heat wave.
